intro: Didymopanax glabratus, commonly known as the smooth-surfaced tree, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often waxy bark and large, compound leaves. The plant typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 15 meters in its natural habitat. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-white in color, and it produces edible fruits that are consumed by various wildlife species. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
